subhead: The Ukrainian army managed to deploy reserves to stop Moscow's soldiers north of Pokrovsk, but it has struggled to find a response to Russia's new infiltration tactics.

France slams Netanyahu's claim that it fuels antisemitism as 'abject' and 'erroneous'
subhead: After the Israeli prime minister condemned Macron's plan to recognize Palestinian statehood, claiming it 'encourages the Jew-hatred now stalking [France's] streets,' the Elysée Palace responded by insisting that it 'protects and will always protect its Jewish citizens.'

headline: 'In Syria, stemming the illicit proliferation of small arms and light weapons is central'
subhead: According to estimates, tens of thousands of Syrian weapons have already been stolen or trafficked. Mark Downes, director of the Small Arms Survey research center, calls for international assistance in this matter.

headline: In Hyères, gold bars are replaced by photographs, sculptures and paintings
subhead: 'Strange places for an exhibition' (2/6). Le Monde explores six art centers set up in unusual locations. Today: a former financial institution turned municipal museum.

headline: Trump's election, a response to 'anti-racist gurus'
subhead: 'Letters from America' (3/6). Writer and journalist Thomas Chatterton Williams examines the omnipresence of race in American debate since the murder of George Floyd in 2020. He argues that the consequences have been severe.

The rise and fall of a gang of crypto-ransom kidnappers
subhead: The criminal group behind a string of violent kidnappings in France that recently made headlines started this activity as early as 2023 and was planning further 'attacks.' Its mastermind was arrested on June 3 in Morocco.

headline: Henri Matisse and his heirs: The end of a financial windfall
subhead: Since Henri Matisse's death in 1954, four generations of his family have guarded his vast body of work jealously and with the utmost discretion. But when the painter's work entered the public domain in January, it ended the lucrative reproduction rights the heirs had enjoyed, as well as their oversight of everything concerning their ancestor.

headline: In Poland, thousands of young people are spending their 'vacation with the army'
subhead: Launched in 2024, this program drew about 10,000 Poles between the ages of 18 and 35 this summer who, after 27 days of training, have now become reservists in the Polish army.
